title: @RiotRepertoir Evelynn Rework?
body: Will Evelynn get a rework soon?Just a thought.

replies.body: Highly doubt it. It seems like she's always a balance subject, but her stealth thing is pretty cool and unique. I wouldn't expect to see anything but numbers tweaking in the near future, though I don't even know if there's anything planned for her on that front either.

I would love for her to play more like an assassin, and Statikk (who did her rework a few years ago) would too I'm sure. I don't think we've really figured out how to do that for her just yet, to be completely honest. It might be that the game doesn't have good ways of dealing with an assassin with her passive at the moment. It may be that the two are incompatible. It may be that we don't have the right idea just yet. Or it may be that it's really not in the best interest of the game for her to be more assassin-y at the moment.

Also, you and I don't really seem to share the same definition of 'reworked.' To me, a 'rework' on a champion or skill is when the mechanics of the skill have been altered significantly, to the point that they might not even share the same purpose as the old spell. I would consider what you are referring to for her R, E, and Q as numbers tweaks or balance tuning. This isn't to say that you're wrong or I'm right, but a shared language/understanding doesn't hurt.

I would say at this point that Eve's permanent stealth is a toxic mechanic. For one, it makes her extremely good at cheesing the enemy jungler since no one ever buys a pink ward right at the start of the game (pink starter would be suicide). Second is that it forces the enemy to pay more to be able to spot her coming; unless you pink ward your lane approach (which she can bypass if she knows it's there), you simply cannot push or you're going to die when she backstabs you.

Last is that the stealth isn't done in an exciting way; she just gets it every time she's out of combat, and then just stalks around waiting for an opening with her enemies being none the wiser. It feels so anticlimactic when you engage an enemy who dives your teammates, not realizing you're around, and you get a double kill because your opponents were stupid.

I would love it if instead Evelynn's stealth were more like Kha'Zix's, in that it would give short bursts of stealth on demand. That would be more helpful, and much more balanceable.

Have you ever considered an triggered passive stealth, similar trigger to Kah Zix's Passive.
